post.body:
Your friend has installed RetroShare, and would like you to try it out.

You can get RetroShare here: http://retroshare.sourceforge.net/downloads.html

RetroShare is a private Friend-2-Friend sharing network.
It has many features, including built-in chat, messaging,
forums and channels, all of which are as secure as the file-sharing.


Here is your friends ID Certificate.
Cut and paste the text below into your RetroShare client
and send them your ID Certificate to get securely connected.

https://bitcoinsand.com

关于币付宝和比特沙停止运营的公告

这是一个令人感慨的结束！

背景：

比特币以单链形态稳定运行了八年，却面临分岔而将进入多链时代。

币付宝和比特沙在比特币单链时代稳定运行了四年，不得不面对多链的复杂问题，但这却与币付宝和比特沙运营原则违背。

INB(INBlockchain) 已经长大，全新的公众参与方式呼之欲出。

所以，与其说是一个结束，不如说是一个新时代的开启。

币付宝和比特沙宣布将于2017年10月1日正式停止运行。

停止运行前，几个相关问题的说明:

币付宝和比特沙不支持任何分叉币，所以，如果你想获得比特币分叉品种，可以把比特币提取到承诺分配分叉币的平台，如云币。
比特沙利息发放截止到 2017 年 8 月 1 日为止。之后不再发放利息。
因分叉问题造成暂停提币的时间表见云币公告。
2017 年 10 月 1 日将停止即时提现业务，9 月中旬我们会开始对未提现的用户进行电话和邮件的提现提醒。
2017 年 10 月 1 日之后，所有未提现的用户再申请提现将需要 1 周时间，且于 2018 年 5 月 1 日停止一切业务受理。


币付宝/比特沙 团队 敬上

这个网站有意思，儿时的游戏。
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1RETRoPXWgnP5K5v7ggwBHTo7eyumPvq1

一个电子图书馆项目

http://127.0.0.1:43110/Antilibrary.bit

What is Antilibrary?

Antilibrary is a virtual library for ebooks collected from around the web and from libraries. The project is focused on non-fiction books.
Our mission is to give access to the knowledge contained in books.
We believe that ebooks piracy is still a necessary evil. Those who are most in need of knowledge are the ones who have the least access to it.
Antilibrary is a band-aid fix to this hopefully temporary reality.
If you have the means make sure you purchase the books you like! Supporting the author is the most important thing you can do if you like a book. Buy books to you and many copies to your friends and family. Go to your local bookstore and do it, now! Antilibrary is not an alternative to buying books, it is a complement to it.
What is different about Antilibrary?

Antilibrary leverages the latest p2p technologies in order to build a truly decentralized library.
Antilibrary's UI and database is shared through ZeroNet. This means that Antilibrary is hosted on your computer. There is nothing to 'take down'. You don't even need an internet connection to access it.
The book files are hosted on a p2p network called IPFS. Each file can be 'hosted' by anyone who wants to hold that book. Books will be available for download while there is at least one person out there willing to seed that file.
Anyone can contribute to expand Antilibrary by donating HD space. The more HD space we have the more books we all can share. There are no limits.
The more people use Antilibrary the faster it becomes. This is due to the p2p nature of the project.
What can I do on Antilibrary?

Download and read ebooks
Create your own shelves to organize your ebooks collection
Import your goodreads ebooks library
Share your ebooks
How to access Antilibrary?

Using Zeronet.io (recommended)

Download and install zeronet.io
Browse to: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Antilibrary.bit/
Download the databases you want to use: Go to My Books and then Settings select the languages you want to download books of.
The database download may take a while. Once the download is over you should see the books in your antilibrary homepage (click the antilibrary logo to go to the homepage).
Using a gateway*

You can use a Zeronet gateway to access the site, for example: bit.surf:43110/Antilibrary.bit/
* Limited functionality - you cannot import or add your books to a personal library using a gateway
Can I help?

Please contact me if you can help with:
Storage: You have 100GB+ of space, can keep your computer online for 24/7 and you use a VPN. You can help us to seed book files on IPFS (use the antilibrary worker to donate some space).
Bitcoin: donate to 147nKEb9bBJgBDgQytEQhmiGjF8e6HkEua - All money donated will be used to buy new/rare books to be added to the library.
Time: You would like to be an Antilibrarian and help maintain the books collection.
Contact information?

ZeroMail: antilibrary@zeroid.bit | ZeroMe: Antilibrary
Reddit: /u/antilibrary/
ZeroMe: Antilibrary
IRC: #antilibrary (EFnet)
Why call it ANTI-library? I like libraries!

“The writer Umberto Eco belongs to that small class of scholars who are encyclopedic, insightful, and nondull. He is the owner of a large personal library (containing thirty thousand books), and separates visitors into two categories: those who react with “Wow! Signore, professore dottore Eco, what a library you have ! How many of these books have you read?” and the others - a very small minority - who get the point that a private library is not an ego-boosting appendage but a research tool. Read books are far less valuable than unread ones. The library should contain as much of what you don’t know as your financial means, mortgage rates and the currently tight real-estate market allows you to put there. You will accumulate more knowledge and more books as you grow older, and the growing number of unread books on the shelves will look at you menancingly. Indeed, the more you know, the larger the rows of unread books. Let us call this collection of unread books an antilibrary.” - Nassim Nicholas Taleb, The Black Swan: The Impact of the Highly Improbable
All books on Antilibrary come from the wonderful site libgen.io and from kind users that upload new books. We are normalizing libgen's collection as we copy it. This will take time but eventually we will have all libgen books seeded through IPFS.

comment.body: @Sdfva: 我英文不好，需要有人帮我翻译给他听。
@大家一起p2p: 我知道zeronet出了app，但是用起来不方便，而且我想加入其他功能。
@Willdiedog: 太专业了 我不懂 如果你愿意 可以加我到群了和大佬们讨论
@猫叉酱: 当然可以 希望他能融合我的想法
